Caption: Prof. M.V.C. Sastry reads out the names of degree holders
Description: The third convocation of IIT Madras was held on the 30th of July, 1966. The convocation took place on a Saturday evening at the Instituteâ€™s Open Air Theater. A total of 305 students (203 B. Tech. degrees, 38 M. Sc. degrees and 64 M. Tech. degrees) received their degrees at the ceremony. The event commenced with an invocation, and the ceremony was declared open by Dr. A. L. Mudaliar (Padma Bhushan, Padma Vibhushan), the Chairman of the Board of Governors. This was preceded by the department vise passing of grace. There were 15 departments at the time. In the photo,  Prof. M.V.C. Sastry ( Head of the Chemistry department) reads out the names of degree holders from his department, and the students approach the stage to receive their degrees.
